Articles.Content: Are we all trying this on clean installs , might be tweakscale issue

Are the parts scalable?
^This, downloaded pre-alpha dev WIP ver 0.0.0.0.2 and still nothing.
Ditto for me too.

Correct - can you guys try on a clean install with nothing but the Karbonite zip? Need to see where this conflict is.

the Karbonite and MKS units say they use MW, but what they mean by that is a sort of EC, it's not related to KSP interstellar at all. I know it sounds the same, but it's not related. regular EC will work.

Because that is not confusing at all. Near Future, Interstellar and a number of other mods (I have heard the devs have confirmed it but can't find a direct source) refer to 1 EC as roughly 1 kW. Referring it to MW is downright confusing. Might I suggest changing it to EC at the very least to avoid ambiguity or confusion?

Because that is not confusing at all. Near Future, Interstellar and a number of other mods (I have heard the devs have confirmed it but can't find a direct source) refer to 1 EC as roughly 1 kW. Referring it to MW is downright confusing. Might I suggest changing it to EC at the very least to avoid ambiguity or confusion?

No can do, that's a function of ORS.
Tried it in a freshly squeezed glass of KSP. Still just as many calories.
Sweet logo and nice mod. This IS the mod I've been looking for. Competition makes everything so much better after all.

Tried it in a freshly squeezed glass of KSP. Still just as many calories.

Fair enough - looks like it may be me as my KSP was still .24.0 - let me try recompilation with 0.24.1
Ah - I'm running .24.2?

I'll try it in 0.24.0 to see.

Edit - Wait what? .2? Damn SQUAD and their updates.

Correct - can you guys try on a clean install with nothing but the Karbonite zip? Need to see where this conflict is.

Downloading it now to try now on my clean save, I hate not having clouds though . I will report any "bad things" that may crop up.
Okay, it works in 24.0.
I was using .24.0; I didn't know they were at 24.2 already.
Looks like ORS got all nice and broke in 0.24.2 - let me get to work.
Ok - found the bug in ORS. Looks like I get to fork and do a pull request Thank god this has a permissive license.
Yay open stuff

Yay open stuff

I second that Yay for open license
LOL so it was .24 and we were trying on 24.2

Ok - found the bug in ORS. Looks like I get to fork and do a pull request Thank god this has a permissive license.

What changed between .1 and .2?
Theoretically just the right click bug was fixed

Theoretically just the right click bug was fixed

...and they added a new parameter to a core method...

New version up, 0.24.2 compatible. DELETE YOUR OpenResourceSystem and your Karbonite folders first!!!!

...and they added a new parameter to a core method...

New version up, 0.24.2 compatible. DELETE YOUR OpenResourceSystem and your Karbonite folders first!!!!

Dude you just made a resource gathering mod in 3 days, and fixed the same bug the new patch brought to Kethane in under 20 minutes . Cheers to you Sire !

Edit. Just tested under .24.2 Working good so far !!!! And the new antena LOL man i have to give it to you , its pretty cool and dead on kerbal style !

Edit2 :.. Now I have few questions.

1. Does it work when the vessel is not active?

2. What is the ratio of convertion to fuel/ox/mono ?

3. What is the range to scan hotspots? Or do they reveal on the entire map automatically ?

Edited July 26, 2014 by nismobg

Dude you just made a resource gathering mod in 3 days, and fixed the same bug the new patch brought to Kethane in under 20 minutes . Cheers to you Sire !

Edit. Just tested under .24.2 Working good so far !!!! And the new antena LOL man i have to give it to you , its pretty cool and dead on kerbal style !

And now I am going to go grab a beer.

Pull request sent to FractalUK, offered up my services if he needs a hand as I now have a vested interest in ORS

Pull request sent to FractalUK, offered up my services if he needs a hand as I now have a vested interest in ORS

He hasn't been active since 22 march, so ehm ...

Awesome points

1. Drill wise, I think it's more a case of form factor than size - I like the idea of an inline drill that would pop out and extend down, vs. having to deal with balancing heavy radial drills.

One possibility is to have a radial drill of mass x, and then some other radially mounted utility (like a conversion processor) with mass x at the same center to perfectly offset the drill. Though you've probably already thought of this.

Everything appears to be working for me besides the map - still don't graphically see any hotspots, but the rest is A-OK.

Enjoy the beer!
